findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens, which can lead to highly inflated contract tokens if abused.

findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to claim all the tokens held by the contract. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `recoverToken` function.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract, which may lead to unexpected versions and vulnerabilities.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
